text: Which one is wrong about the income statement?

options.A: It reports the revenues and expenses in an organized manner
options.B: The income statement starts with gross sales
options.C: A high sales allowance indicates customer dissatisfaction
options.D: To determine it, only sales returns are deducted from the gross sales
options.E: Reports the financial performance for the time periods

explanation: Income statement is the most important tool to understand and evaluate the efficiency of operations. It reports what the business earned and consumed. What the business earned shows the revenues; and what the business consumed shows expenses. Income statement reports the revenues and expenses in an organized manner. The income statement starts with gross sales. From the gross sales, sales discounts are deducted. Sales discounts are discounts used to encourage the customers to make an early payment. If a customer accepts to pay in the discount period, then the customer pays less than the gross amount. From the gross sales, sales returns and allowances are also deducted. As the name indicates, sales returns are those sales the customer wants to cancel later. Sales allowance means that the customer is not satisfied with the product, but instead of returning them, agrees to keep the product for a price cut. If this amount is relatively high, it indicates a problem related to customer satisfaction. After deducting the sales discounts and sales returns and allowances from the gross sales, net sales are obtained.

text: Earning per share Profit before interest and taxes 2020 100 1000 2021 120 1100 What is the value of financial leverage for the hypothetical company whose financial data given in the above table?
explanation:
Financial leverage is the ratio of percentage change in earning per share to percentage change in profit before interest and taxes. Therefore:
 Leverage = ((120 - 100)/100)/((1100 - 1000)/1000) = 0,2/0,1 = 2

text: The interest coverage ratio of a company is increasing during the last three years such as 2.4, 4.3 and 6.5. What will the analyst think about the long term debt paying ability of the company?

options.A: The company's risk of default for the interest payments will become lower and when the default risk of a company is low, the company will have more ability to roll over the existing principal payments.
options.B: The company's risk of default for the interest payments will become higher and when the default risk of a company is high, the company will have more ability to roll over the existing principal payments.
options.C: Such an increase in the interest coverage ratio will lower paying ability of the company and is sourced by the increase in the interest expense and decrease in the operational profit.
options.D: Such an increase in the interest coverage ratio will increase the default risk of a company and will reduce the paying ability of the company.
options.E: It can be said that the company paid its low interest long term borrowings in the last year by using high interest short term financing and only the ordinary income items should be taken into account.

explanation: The interest coverage ratio determines the long term debt paying ability in the means of the income statement. The higher the interest coverage ratio is, the lower the risk of default for the interest payments becomes. When the default risk of a company is low, it has more ability to roll over the existing principal payments.
